homes_hear_details: Nebraska has not yet launched its HOMES or HEAR rebate programs under the Inflation Reduction Act. The Nebraska Energy Office is the designated state entity coordinating with the U.S. Department of Energy on program design and implementation.

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For Nebraska, 80% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Douglas County (Omaha), 80% AMI for a family of four is approximately $66,250. Rural counties may be lower.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For Nebraska, 150% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Douglas County (Omaha), 150% AMI for a family of four is approximately $124,200.

net_metering: Nebraska has statewide net metering rules established by the Nebraska Power Review Board. Customers with systems up to 25 kW can net meter with their local public power district. Excess generation is credited at the utility's avoided cost rate, which is typically below the retail rate.

state_rebate_programs.name: Nebraska Dollar and Energy Saving Loans
state_rebate_programs.amount: Low-interest loans (5% or below) up to $100,000 for residential projects
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Energy efficiency improvements, insulation, HVAC upgrades, solar panels, geothermal systems, windows
state_rebate_programs.details: The Nebraska Energy Office partners with local lending institutions to provide reduced-interest loans for energy efficiency and renewable energy improvements. Available to homeowners, businesses, and agricultural operations.

state_rebate_programs.name: Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.amount: Average expenditure of approximately $7,500 per home
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, heating/cooling system repair or replacement, window and door improvements
state_rebate_programs.details: Federally funded program for income-qualifying households at or below 200% of federal poverty level. Administered through community action agencies across Nebraska.

programs.name: Residential Efficiency Rebates
programs.amount: Up to $1,000 for HVAC, $500 for insulation, $100 for smart thermostats
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency HVAC systems, insulation, air sealing, smart thermostats, ENERGY STAR appliances

programs.name: Home Energy Audit
programs.amount: Free or reduced-cost home energy assessment
programs.eligible_items: Comprehensive home energy evaluation identifying savings opportunities

programs.name: Sustainable Energy Program (SEP)
programs.amount: Up to $600 for HVAC, $250 for insulation, $50 for smart thermostats
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency heat pumps, central air conditioners, insulation, smart thermostats

programs.name: LES Home Energy Audit
programs.eligible_items: Home energy audit identifying efficiency improvement opportunities

programs.name: EnergyWise Residential Rebates
programs.amount: Varies by measure; up to $500 for qualifying equipment
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency HVAC systems, water heaters, insulation
